column1: Janet's ducks lay 16 eggs a day. She eats three every morning for breakfast and bakes four muffins every day for her friends. The rest she sells at the farmers' market for $2 a day for each fresh duck egg. How many dollars does she make a day at the farmers' market?
A dress requires two cords of blue wool and half as much white wool.
Josh decides to sell a house, he buys a house for $80,000, and then puts $50,000 into repairs, which increases the value of the house by 150%.
James decides to do three short runs three times a week, each time he runs 60 yards. How many yards does he run in a week?

Wendi feeds each of her chickens three cups of mixed chicken feed, with seeds, mealworms, and vegetables, every day to keep them healthy. She feeds the chickens in three separate meals. In the morning, she feeds her flock of chickens 15 cups of feed. In the afternoon, she gives the chickens another 25 cups of feed. How many cups of feed does she need to feed the chickens the last meal of the day, if Wendi's flock of chickens consists of 20 chickens?

Kylar goes to the store to buy glasses for his new apartment. A glass costs 5 US dollars, but each additional glass costs only 60% of the original price. Kylar wants to buy 16 glasses. How much does he have to spend for it?
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston, Charleston has four times as many sheep as Seattle, how many sheep do Toulouse, Charleston and Seattle have together, if Seattle has 20 sheep?

Carla downloads a 200 GB file. Normally she can download 2 GB/min, but after 40% of the download is complete, Windows forces a restart to install updates, which takes 20 minutes. After that, Carla has to start the download all over again. How long does it take to download the file?

John drives for three hours at 60 miles per hour and then turns around because he realizes that he forgot something very important at home. He tries to get home within four hours, but he spends the first two hours in traffic. The next half hour he drives at 30 miles per hour before he can continue the remaining four hours at 80 miles per hour. How far away from home is he at the end of those four hours?

Eliza's salary for the first 40 hours she works a week is 10 U.S. dollars. She also gets paid for overtime at 1.2 times the normal hourly rate. How much does Eliza earn if she works 45 hours this week?

A new program was downloaded 60 times in the first month, and in the second month, the number of downloads was three times the number of downloads in the first month, but then it dropped by 30 percent in the third month.

Toula went to the bakery and bought different kinds of pastries. She bought three dozen doughnuts, which cost $68 a dozen, two dozen mini cupcakes, which cost $80 a dozen, and six dozen mini cheesecakes, which cost $55 a dozen. What was the total cost?

Carlos plants a lemon tree. It costs $90 to plant the tree. Each year he grows seven lemons that he can sell for $1.50 each. It costs $3 a year to water and fertilize the tree. How many years does it take for him to make money from the lemon tree?

Melanie is a sales rep. She sold one third of her vacuums in the green house, two more in the red house, and half of the remaining ones in the orange house. If Melanie has five vacuums left, how many did she start with?
In a dance class with 20 students, 20 percent signed up for contemporary dance, 25 percent of the rest signed up for jazz dance, and the rest signed up for hip-hop.

A trader wants to make a purchase decision between two purchase options: jewelry worth $5,000 or electronics worth $8,000. His financial advisor assumes that the jewelry market will grow by 2.5% and the electrical appliance market by 1.2% in the same month. If the trader wants to maximize profit by making a purchase decision at the end of the month, how much profit would he make?
Two trains leave San Rafael at the same time, they start heading west and they both travel 80 miles, the next day they head north and they travel 150 miles.

Jill gets paid $20 an hour for teaching as a teacher and $30 an hour for cheerleading coach, so if she works 50 weeks a year, 35 weeks a week as a teacher and 15 hours a week as a coach, what is her annual salary?
Claire makes herself an omelet of three eggs for breakfast every morning. How many dozen eggs does she eat in four weeks?

Marissa walks a 12-mile hiking trail. In the first hour, she walks the first 4 miles, then the next two miles in the next hour. If she wants to walk at an average speed of 4 miles per hour, at what speed (miles per hour) does she have to walk the rest of the way?

I have 10 liters of orange juice with two thirds water and I want to add it to 15 liters of pineapple juice with three fifths water, but when I pour it, I spill a liter of the orange juice. How much water is in the remaining 24 liters?
Raymond and Samantha are cousins. Raymond was born six years before Samantha. Raymond had a son when he was 23. If Samantha is now 31, how many years ago was Raymond's son born?

Billy sells DVDs. He has eight customers on Tuesday. His first three customers each buy one DVD. His next two customers each buy two DVDs. His last three customers don't buy any DVDs. How many DVDs did Billy sell on Tuesday?
A candle melts by two centimeters every hour it burns, so how many centimeters shorter is a candle that burns from 1 p.m. to 5 p.m.?
Kyle bought last year's bestseller for $19.50, which is a 25% discount on the original price. What was the original price of the book?

Marie ordered a chicken dish for $12 dollars, five packets of milk for $3 each, four apples for $1.50 each, and a couple of boxes of pizza. Marie paid a total of $50 dollars. How many boxes of pizza did Marie order if each box cost $8.50 dollars?

Mishka bought three pairs of shorts, three pairs of pants, and three pairs of shoes. A pair of shorts costs $16.50 US dollars. A pair of pants costs $22.50 US dollars, and a pair of shoes costs $42 US dollars. How many dollars did Mishka spend on the clothes in total?
Cynthia eats one serving of ice cream every night. She buys ice cream cartons with 15 servings of ice cream per carton for $4.00 per carton. How much did she spend on ice cream after 60 days?
Henry made two stops on a 60-mile bike tour. His first stop was at 20 miles. The second stop was 15 miles before the end of the tour. How many miles did he cover between the first and second stops?

Gloria is shopping for shoes when she finds a pair of boots that fits her budget. However, she has to choose between the boots and two pairs of high heels that together cost five dollars less than the boots. If one pair of high heels costs 33 dollars and the other is twice as much, how much do the boots cost?
If they're 162 years old now, calculate how old Allen will be in 10 years.

Gunter tries to count the gummy bears in the glass. He asks his friends how many gummy bears they think are in the glass. One says 80, the other says 20 more than half the first estimate. A third says 25 percent more than the first estimate. What is their average estimate?
John takes care of 10 dogs. Each dog takes half an hour a day to walk and to do his business. How many hours a week does he take care of the dogs in total?
Gretchen has 110 coins. There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins. How many gold coins does Gretchen have?
If Raymond has 40 pieces of jewelry, how many pieces of jewelry does Siobhan have?
Mike plays ping-pong for 40 minutes, and in the first 20 minutes he scores four points, and in the next 20 minutes he scores 25 percent more points.
Terry eats two yogurts a day. They're currently on sale for $5.00 for four yogurts. How much does he spend on yogurt over a 30-day period?

John plans to sell all his toys and use the proceeds to buy video games. He has 13 Lego sets and sells them for $15 each. Eventually, he buys eight video games for $20 each and has $5 left. How many Lego sets does he have left?
John runs 60 miles a week. He runs three days a week. He runs three hours on the first day and half an hour on the other two days. How fast does he run?

Dana can run four times as fast as she can walk, but she can only jump at half her walking speed. If she can jump at three miles per hour, how many miles can she cover in six hours if she walks one-third of the time and walks two-thirds of the time?
Brandon's iPhone is four times as old as Ben's iPhone. Ben's iPhone is twice as old as Suzie's iPhone. If Suzie's iPhone is one year old, how old is Brandon's iPhone?

The great dragon Perg sat high on Mount Farbo, spewing fire at everything within a radius of 1,000 feet. Polly could throw the golden spear, the only known weapon with which the dragon could defeat him, 400 feet wide, well within the range of the flames thrown out by the dragon. But when Polly held the sapphire gemstone in her hands, she could throw the spear three times as far as without the gemstone in her hands. If she held the gemstone in her hands, how far outside the range of the dragon's flames could Polly stand and still hit the dragon with the golden spear?

Grandma Jones baked five apple pies for the fire department's lunch. She cut each cake into eight pieces and placed five cakes on the buffet table so that guests could serve themselves. At the end of the evening, after guests had served themselves and eaten cakes, there were 14 pieces of cake left. How many pieces did the guests take?

According to the nutrition facts, a bag of chips has 250 calories per serving, so if a 300-gram bag contains five servings, how many grams can you eat if your daily calorie target is 2,000 and you've already eaten 1,800 calories?

Charlie wants to sell beeswax candles. From every pound of beeswax, he can make 10 cone candles. The accessory from a pound of beeswax plus wicks costs $10.00 U.S. If he sells the candles for $2.00, how much net profit does he make if he makes and sells 20 candles?

Meredith is a freelance blogger who writes about health and customer service, which is her regular job. Researching and writing a blog post takes an average of four hours. Last week, she wrote five articles on Monday, and two-fifths more articles on Tuesday than she did on Monday. She wrote twice as many articles on Wednesday as she did on Tuesday.

Candice put 80 Post-its in her purse before she left for her job at the coffee shop. On the way, she stopped at the store and bought a pack of Post-its; at work, she put one Post-it on each of 220 different cups of coffee. If she had 23 Post-its left, how many Post-its were in the pack she bought?
John buys twice as many red ties as blue ties. The red ties cost 50% more than the blue ties. He spent $200 on blue ties, which cost $40 each. How much did he spend on ties?
Tracy used a 4-foot piece of wire to support the tomato plants in her garden. The wire was cut into 6-inch pieces. How many pieces of wire did she have?
Richard lives in a 15-story apartment building. There are eight apartments on each floor, and three-quarters of the building is occupied. How many apartments in the building are unoccupied in total?
Lloyd has an egg farm. His hens lay 252 eggs a day and he sells them for $2 a dozen. How much does Lloyd make a week from the eggs?
Tom's ship can travel 10 miles per hour. It sails from 1 to 4 p.m. Then it travels back at a speed of 6 miles per hour. How long does it take him to get back?

Uriah's bag gets too heavy. He has to take out 15 pounds. His comic books weigh a quarter of a pound each and his toys each weigh a half pound. If he takes out 30 comic books, how many toys does he have to take out?

A mechanic charges different rates for repairing truck and car tires. For each truck tire repaired, the mechanic charges $60 and for each car tire repaired, the mechanic charges $40. On Thursday, the mechanic repairs 6 truck tires and 4 car tires. On Friday, the mechanic repairs 12 car tires and does not repair truck tires. How much sales did the mechanic make on the day with the higher sales?

The Doubtfire sisters are driving home with seven kittens they have adopted from the local shelter when their mother calls to tell them that their two pet cats have just given birth to kittens. She says that Patchy, the first cat, has three times as many kittens as the adopted ones, while Trixie, the other cat, has given birth to 12. How many kittens have the Doubtfires now?
Jean has 30 lollipops. Jean eats 2 of the lollipops. The remaining lollipops Jean wants to put in a bag with 2 lollipops each. How many bags can Jean fill?
Peter plans to go to the movies this week. He always buys a $7 ticket and $7 popcorn. If he has $42 for the week, how often can he go to the movies?

A wooden bridge can't carry more than 5,000 pounds. A van loaded with identical boxes, each weighing 15 pounds, will drive across the bridge. The total weight of driver and empty truck is 3,755 pounds. What is the maximum number of boxes the truck can load without exceeding the weight limit of the bridge?

Stephen placed an online food order. The final invoice was $40.00 USD. Since the delivery was made by a delivery service provider, they added a 25% fee to the final invoice and charged him $3.00 USD for delivery. Stephen also gave $4.00 USD in tips. After the extra fees, what was the final price of Stephen's food?
A raspberry tree has 6 grapes with 20 fruits each and 67 individual fruits spread across the bush. How many raspberries are there in total?
A basket contains 25 oranges, of which one is bad, 20% is unripe, and 2 are sour, and the rest is good. How many oranges are good?

Janet buys a brooch for her daughter. She pays $500 for the material to make it, and another $800 for the jeweler to model it. Then she pays 10% of that amount to insure it. How much did she have to pay?

If Marcy works for the same company for 40 years, she gets an annual pension of $50,000 per year. After 20 years, she is granted 5% of the value of the annual pension per year. If she leaves after 30 years, what is her annual pension?

Aleena has a subscription to a streaming service that charges $140 per month, so if the streaming company charges her the original amount for the first half of the year and then charges her 10% less for the second half of the year, calculate the total amount she will have paid for the streaming service by the end of the year.

Sophia is thinking about taking a road trip with her car and wants to know how far she will go with a full tank of gas. Since the last filling, she has driven 100 miles, and she had to refill 4 gallons of gas to fill the tank completely. The owner's manual for her car says that her tank will fit 12 gallons of gas. How many miles can Sophia travel with a single filling?
Jim watches TV for two hours and then decides to go to bed and read for half that time. He does that three times a week. How many hours does he spend watching TV and reading in four weeks?

Four schools compete against each other in a basketball tournament. Each school has sent a girls basketball team and a boys basketball team and each team has five players. All the schools have also sent a coach for each team. How many people have the schools sent in total?

A treasure hunter found a buried treasure chest of precious stones. There were 175 diamonds, 35 fewer rubies than diamonds, and twice as many emeralds as rubies. How many precious stones were in the treasure chest?
There are twice as many boys as girls at Dr. Wertz's school. If there are 60 girls and 5 students per teacher, how many teachers are there?

Bailey starts with a certain amount of money, then she gets paid $5 a week for eight weeks, and then at the end of the eight weeks, if she has a total of $100, how much money did Bailey have at the beginning?
Judy teaches five dance classes a day on the weekends and eight classes on Saturdays, and if each class has 15 students and she charges $15.00 per student, how much money does she make in a week?

Kelian has two recipes, one containing 20 instructions and the other containing twice as many instructions as the first. How many instructions does Kelian have to read in order to prepare the two recipes?
Tommy collects for his charity by selling brownies for $3 each and cheesecake pieces for $4 each. If Tommy sells 43 brownies and 23 cheesecake pieces, how much money does he collect?
Shiela bought five cell phones for $150 each with a three-month installment contract, each with a 2% interest rate. How much does Shiela pay each month for three months?

Artie has a flower stand at the farmers' market. He sells three types of flowers: marigolds, petunias, and begonias. He usually sells marigolds for $2.74 a pot, petunias for $1.87 a pot, and begonias for $2.12 a pot. Artie doesn't have change today, so he decides to round up all prices to the next highest dollar amount. If Artie sells 12 pots of marigolds, 9 pots of petunias, and 17 pots of begonias, how much does he make?

Luke spends time on the beach building sand castles, and he eventually realizes that each level of a sand castle is only half the square footage of the level below it. If he builds a four-story sand castle with a top level of 16 square feet, what is the average square footage of a level?

Cecilia has just bought a new puppy. According to her veterinarian, she must feed the puppy one cup of dog food a day for the first 180 days. After that, she must feed the puppy two cups of dog food a day for the rest of his life. If a bag of dog food contains 110 cup portions, how many bags of dog food does Cecilia consume in the first year?

If Raymond washes half as much laundry as Sarah, and Sarah washes four times as much laundry as David, calculate the difference in the amount of laundry that Raymond and David wash when Sarah washes 400 pounds of laundry.
Vincent can buy flowers in 3-pack for $2.50 or in 2-pack for $1. How much money does he save by buying 18 flowers at the better price?
John adopts a dog. He takes the dog to the dog groomer, which costs $100. The dog groomer offers him a 30% discount because he's a new customer. How much is the dog groomer's session?
Two girls each got 1/6 of the 24 liters of water, then one boy got 6 liters of water, how many liters of water were left?

Charlie had 10 stickers. He bought 21 stickers at a store in the mall and got 23 stickers for his birthday. Then Charlie gave his sister 9 of the stickers and used 28 to decorate a greeting card. How many stickers does Charlie have left?
Grace weighs 125 pounds. Alex weighs two pounds less than four times Grace's weight. How many pounds do they weigh together?
Dan plants three rose bushes. Each rose bush bears 25 roses. Each rose has eight thorns. How many thorns are there in total?
A football team plays 22 games. They've won 8 more than they've lost. How many have they won?

Gene sews a blanket from old T-shirts he has worn on vacation. He has a T-shirt from every vacation he's been on. Each shirt is a different blanket. Each row is made from a different vacation year's blanket. He's been on vacation four times a year and traveling since he was 23. He's 34 now. How many blanket sections does he have?

Greg has set an alarm clock that rings three times a day as a reminder. When the alarm clock goes off, it rings until Greg turns it off. When it went off for the first time today, it ringed four times. The second time it went off, it ringed three times as long as the first time. The third time it ringed half as long as the second time. How many times has the alarm clock ringed in total?

A company pays each of its employees $600 per month. The company has a company policy where all employees are paid 10% of their original salary for those who have been with the company for five years. If Sylvie was with the company for exactly five years last December, what is her salary after another three years?
Marilyn's first record sold ten times as many copies as Harald's, so if they sold 88,000 copies together, how many copies did Harald sell?

Christina is planning a birthday party and needs 0.75 gift bags for each guest invited, since 1/4 of the guests will not show up. She has invited 16 friends. The gift bags cost $2 each. How much does she spend?

Ted the T-Rex plans to bring potato salad to the dinopicknick. He knows that an adult dinosaur eats 10 pounds of potato salad, and a juvenile eats half as much as an adult animal. If there are 20 adults and five juveniles at the picnic, how much potato salad does Ted have to bring to the picnic if he hopes to fill everyone?
Jan has three times as many pets as Marcia. Marcia has two more pets than Cindy. If Cindy has four pets, how many pets do all three of them have together?

Emily has four children named Amy, Jackson, Corey, and James. Amy is five years older than Jackson and two years younger than Corey. If James is ten years old and one year younger than Corey, how old is Jackson?

Lee was able to run the 400 meter hurdles two seconds faster than Gerald is running the 400 meter hurdles. Gerald, however, has changed his diet, which has improved his speed by 10 percent. If Lee runs the 400 meter hurdles in 38 seconds, how fast can Gerald, with his improved diet, run the 400 meter hurdles in seconds?

In a residential neighborhood, the number of rabbits as pets is twelve times less than the number of dogs and cats as pets combined. If there are two cats for every dog, and there are 60 dogs, how many pets are there in the neighborhood?
Of the 200 students in the fifth grade, two-fifths are boys and two-thirds are girls in the Girl Scouts.
Harry slept nine hours last night, and his friend James slept only two-thirds as much as Harry did.

When Freda cooks tomatoes in cans for sauce, they lose half their weight. Each 16-ounce can of tomatoes she uses contains three tomatoes. The last serving of tomato sauce yielded 32 ounces of sauce. How many tomatoes did Freda consume?

On the highway, cars line up. Some of the cars pass through in the first 15 minutes of the traffic jam, then another 20 cars pass through in the remaining 15 minutes of the traffic jam. Five cars get out of line so they don't have to go through the traffic jam. If there were originally 30 cars on the highway, how many cars passed through the traffic jam in the first 15 minutes?

Mary is a passionate gardener. She got 18 new potted plants yesterday from her favorite garden company. She already has two potted plants on each of the 40 window sills of her large country house. She is generous and has decided that she would like to give one potted plant from each window sill to friends and family tomorrow. How many potted plants will Mary have left?

Jerome has four friends who visited him on a certain day. The first friend rang the doorbell 20 times before Jerome opened it, the second friend rang the doorbell 1/4 times more often than Jerome's first friend. The third friend rang the doorbell 10 times more often than the fourth friend. If the fourth friend rang the doorbell 60 times, how many times did the doorbell ring altogether?

Solo has to read four pages from his science textbook, 20 pages from his community-based textbook, seven pages from his history book, and eight pages from his geography book. Solo reads 15 pages on Monday. If he has four days left to read everything, how many pages does he have to read per day on average?

John likes to drink a glass of water for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Finally, he also drinks one before going to bed. John does this every day of the week, but on weekends he likes to relax and instead drinks a glass of lemonade for dinner. How many glasses of water does John drink per week?

A cloud of fog comes from the ocean and covers a city, and it takes 10 minutes to cover 3 miles of the city each time. If the city stretches 42 miles from the ocean shore to the opposite inland, how many minutes does it take for the cloud to cover the entire city?
Poppy solves a 1,000-piece puzzle, she puts a quarter of the pieces on the board, then her mom puts a third of the remaining pieces, how many pieces of the puzzle are left to put together?
Cody eats three times as many cookies as Amir. If Amir eats five cookies, how many cookies will they both eat together?
John has three boxes. Each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches. The walls are 1 inch thick. What is the internal volume of all three boxes combined?

Frankie watches TV every night after he's done his homework. On Monday and Tuesday, he watched a one-hour episode of his favorite show. On Wednesday, he watched a few episodes of a 30-minute show. On Thursday, he finished his homework early and watched a one-hour episode and a 30-minute show. On Friday, he was allowed to stay up later because of the weekend and watched two one-hour episodes. If he watched a total of seven hours of television, how many 30-minute episodes did he watch on Wednesday?

Henry is baking cookies for a regional baking competition. He wants to bake twice as many as last year. When he's done baking, he realizes he's baked 15 more cookies than he originally wanted. He drops five of his cookies when he takes them out to cool, and now he has a total of 110 cookies. How many cookies did Henry bake last year?

A local gas station sells gas for $3.00 a gallon, an app company offers a $20 refund if you fill up at that gas station, if someone buys 10 gallons of gas, how much does the gas cost after the refund?

Marcell and Beatrice are having a competition to see who can eat the most fruit rolls, so they're rolling out all the ones they can find. Unfortunately, someone makes a mistake, and Beatrice's was two rolls wide and 24 rolls long, while Marcell's was three rolls wide and 14 rolls long. If they both eat their entire amount, on average, how many did they eat?

Julia's boat had a leak when she was out on the lake. The boat swallowed two liters of water for every ten feet she rowed back to shore. It took her sixteen seconds to row twenty feet. The beach was 64 seconds away. How much water had the boat swallowed when Julia reached the beach?

A classroom has a whiteboard that is shared by the four teachers who take turns using the classroom. Each teacher has two lessons per day and uses the whiteboard in each lesson. If the whiteboard is wiped three times per lesson, how many times per day is the whiteboard wiped?
Ryan plants two flowers a day in his garden, and after 15 days, how many flowers does he have if five have not grown?

Jamal's phone can store six times more photos than Brittany's phone. The maximum number of photos Brittany's phone can store is 50 times the number of birds in Jamal's photo with the ducks in the zoo. If Jamal's phone can store 1,800 photos, how many ducks are in Jamal's photo of the ducks in the zoo?

Sasha notices that the price of wood has gone up by 50 percent in the last few months since she bought wood. Since she has some left over, she decides to sell it. She has ten 2 x 4 x 10 large boards left over, which she paid $10 each. She also has five 4 x 4 x 10 boards, which she bought for $16 each. If she sells them all, how much profit does she make?

Katy makes coffee using teaspoons of sugar and cups of water in the ratio 7:13. If she has used a total of 120 teaspoons of sugar and cups of water, calculate the number of teaspoons of sugar she has used.
John buys two pairs of shoes for each of his three children. They cost $60 a pair. How much did he pay?

A customs official at the main port of the SeaSide Customs Clearance counted 2 containers of imported cars, each containing 5 cars. The next day, more containers were delivered and the total number of cars at the port increased to 30. Calculate the number of containers imported on the second day, assuming that all containers contain 5 cars.

Adrian's salary was 30% higher than Lylah's. Four years later, his salary increased and he was earning 40% more than he was earning four years ago. If Adrian and Lylah's salary increase at the same time and Adrian earned $40,000 four years ago, how do you calculate the total total salary that they both earned four years later?
Miguel uses 2 sheets of paper a week for his drawings. If a drawing block has 30 sheets of paper, how many sheets of paper does he use per month?

Morisette and Kael were asked to bring fruit. Morisette brought five apples and eight oranges, and Kael brought twice as many apples and half as many oranges as Morisette. How many fruits do they have in total?

Sadie slept eight hours on Monday. The next two days she slept two hours less each day because she had some work to do. If she slept an hour more than those two days the rest of the week, how many hours did she sleep in total during the week?
Rosie can run for three hours at ten miles an hour. After that, she runs five miles an hour. How many miles can she run in seven hours?

Jennie helps in her mother's office. She has a stack of 60 letters that need to be stamped and a stack of letters that have already been stamped. She glues stamps to a third of the letters that need to be stamped. If there are now 30 letters in the stack of letters that have already been stamped, how many letters were there in the stack when Jennie started?

Julia was preparing for a dinner party at her house where she wanted to serve stew. She noticed that she didn't have any plastic spoons, so she bought a new pack of spoons. Later, her husband also bought a pack of five new spoons and gave them to Julia. While Julia was preparing the stew, she used three of the spoons to taste the soup. Later, when she set the table, she had a total of 12 spoons. How many spoons were in the pack that Julia bought?
Dylan needed chicken sausage and fish sausage to make sausage buns at a party, and he bought 38 chicken sausage and 6 more fish sausage than chicken sausage. How many sausage did Dylan buy in total?
After transferring to a new school, Amy found 20 more friends than Lily.

Wells' mother sells watermelons, peppers, and oranges at a local store. A watermelon costs three times as much as any single pepper. An orange costs five times less than a watermelon. Dillon is sent to the store to buy four watermelons, 20 peppers, and 10 oranges. What is the total amount of money he spends if each pepper costs $15?

In a hospital, 500 people are examined every day. Each patient is examined for an average of 24 minutes. The doctors charge the hospital $150 per hour, and the hospital charges the patient $200 per hour. How much profit does the hospital make from these consultations?

Nissa hires 60 seasonal workers to play the elves in her department store's Christmas village. One-third of the elves quit after children throw up on them, then 10 of the remaining elves quit after children kick them in the shin. How many elves are left?
In May, Joseph's expenses were $500, and in June, his expenses were $60 less.

Pam and Fred went to a fair. Pam took the roller coaster twice, Fred took the roller coaster four times. After that, each of them decided to take the sled twice. If each trip costs six tickets, how many tickets did you use that day?

On Monday, Walt walked four miles. On Thursday, he walked six times as many miles as he had walked on Monday. From Monday to Wednesday, his total distance was 41 miles. How many miles did he walk on Wednesday?
Tom can afford four car washes a month. If each car wash costs $15, how much does he pay in a year?
Brian's friend Bobby has five video games less than three times as many as Brian. If Brian has 20 video games, but lost five of them just before the comparison was made, how many does Bobby have?
There are 27 unicorns left in the world. One third of them are in the Scottish Highlands. Two thirds of the Scottish unicorns are females. How many Scottish unicorn females are there?

Rory orders two jumbo sandwiches for $7.50, two bags of chips for $1.50, and two cookies for $1.00 each for delivery, and at the checkout, they add a 20% delivery fee, and she wants to add a $5.00 tip.

Mark took a test yesterday that consisted of 75 questions. He completed the test at a rate of 5 questions per hour. Today he took another test with 100 questions at the same rate. If Mark had 8 hours to complete the first test and 6 hours to complete the second test, how many questions did he leave incomplete?
In a chewing gum machine, there are 22 pink chewing gum balls, more than four times the number of blue chewing gum balls. If there are 12 blue chewing gum balls, how many pink ones are there?
Of the 20 cars available for hire, 12 are automatic, 4 are manual and the rest are semi-automatic.
There are 700 bees in a hive, there are twice as many worker bees as baby bees, and there are twice as many baby bees as queen bees.
Jordan plays video games for two hours every day. He also has a part-time job that pays him $10 an hour. How much money would Jordan make in a week if he spent his video game time working?
John buys milk for $2, eggs for $3, light bulbs for $3, cups for $3, and cockroach traps for $4. If there is a 10% tax on all non-food items, the cost is high.

Kim has started his own household budgeting company and calculates how much profit he will make from each of his clients. He already has 3 clients, but is talking to 5 potential clients and is optimistic enough to include them in his calculation. Each client's home needs 2 bottles of bleach and a pack of rags to clean it. The bleach bottles cost $2 each and the pack of rags cost $5 each. These are his only expenses. He calculates that his total income will be $92 a week. The profit is the difference between total income and total expenses, so how many dollars of profit will Lucas make each week?
John has a 10 hectare pineapple field. There are 100 pineapples per hectare. John can harvest his pineapples every three months. How many pineapples can John harvest in a year?

Johnny is picking up the toys on the floor of his room. He spilled a packed Lego set with 500 pieces on the floor, and another one with three times the number of pieces of the 500-piece one, and another one with a quarter of the number of pieces of the 500-piece one. How many blocks does Johnny pick up if he picks up all the Lego bricks?

Debra is watching a hive right now to see how many bees come and go in a day, and in the first six hours, she sees 30 bees leaving the hive, and then in the next six hours, she sees half as many bees coming back, and in the next six hours, she sees twice as many bees leaving the hive as she saw leaving the hive in the first place, and every bee that had flown away before that and hadn't yet returned, then in the next six hours, it comes back to the hive.

Brittany and her mother go to the museum. The entrance fee is $12 for adults and $10 for children. Brittany's mother gives the cashier money for one child's card and one adult's card. If she got $8 change, how much money did she give the cashier in dollars?
Charlie has three times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. James has four times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy. If Charlie has 12 Facebook friends, how many Facebook friends does James have?

Steve and Tim decide to find out who's home faster from school. Steve lives further away than Tim, so he gets to ride his bike. Steve lives three miles from school and can cycle 440 feet per minute. Tim lives two miles from school. If Tim rides his skateboard 264 feet per minute, how long will the winner wait at home before the loser finishes the race?

Shawnda decides that the kids in her neighborhood could really use a bicycle inflation service. She decides that charging per tire is the best way to do it. Each tire costs 25 cents to inflate. On the first day, five people came by on bicycles to have both tires inflated. Three people came by to have all their three-wheel tires inflated. Finally, one person actually came by on a unicycle. How many dollars did she make that day?
Carl buys ten packs of cookies. Each cookie packet has six cookies. Each cookie costs $0.10. How much change does Carl get if he pays with a $10 bill?

Dave bought a big packet of French fries and ate fourteen before a hungry seagull stole the packet from his hand. When the seagull landed, it swallowed half as many French fries as Dave had eaten. Then they pushed three pigeons away from the food, and each pigeon ate three French fries. Later, a raccoon stole two-thirds of the remaining French fries. Ants carried one last French fries out of it and left five behind. How many French fries were in the packet when Dave bought them?

On Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, college student Kimo has three one-hour classes a day. On Tuesdays and Thursdays, he has two two-hour classes a day. A semester has 16 school weeks. How many hours does Kimo spend in a semester attending classes?

Bill bakes 300 buns, 120 chocolate croissants, and 60 baguettes a day. Each bun is 4 inches long, each croissant is 6 inches long, and each baguette is two feet long. If Bill puts all the baked goods together, how long are they in feet?

The zookeeper feeds all the monkeys in the zoo. Every two months he orders all the bananas from a local farm. If every month the monkeys need 200 bananas, the gorillas 400 bananas and the baboons 100 bananas, how many bananas does he have to order to survive two months?

Blake and Kelly have a competition to see who can run farther in 15 minutes. They decide to do it on a football field that's 100 yards long. Blake runs back and forth 15 times. Kelly runs back and forth once and then decides she doesn't want to run next to Blake; so she starts running to the 40-yard line and back. She does this 34 times. How much farther does the winner run than the loser?
Raphael went to buy some school supplies. He bought four pens that cost $1.50 each, two notebooks that cost $4 each, and a huge piece of paper that cost $20. How much did he spend on everything?

Finn watches 11 tadpoles swimming in a pond. Suddenly he sees 6 of them coming out of hiding under a water lily leaf, then he sees 2 of them disappearing under a rock. How many tadpoles can Finn see in the pond now?

A water tank is 17 feet deep on Monday. On Tuesday, the tank has 7 feet more water. On Wednesday, the water depth is two-thirds of what it was on Tuesday. What is the water depth of the tank on Wednesday?

Anakin and Locsin went to the beach today. Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 seahorses, and 3 clownfish. Locsin caught 5 starfish less, 3 seahorses less, and 2 clownfish more than Anakin. How many fish did they catch?
If a bag of marbles costs $20 and the price goes up 20% of the original price every two months, how much would a bag of marbles cost after 36 months?

In a room there are different toys: 5 red cars, 3 action figures and a doll. The doll costs as much as 3 action figures, and a red car costs $4. How much is all the toys worth if one action figure costs $5.

Jackie is trying to decide whether to do her own tax return or hire an accountant. If she does the tax return herself, she can cut three hours of freelance work and lose $35 an hour in lost income. The accountant charges $90. How much more money will she have if she hires the accountant?

For his 30th birthday, Elvira wants a new computer with lots of accessories as a gift. She has a budget of €1,500, donated by her whole family, and thinks she can save some money to afford a piece of clothing. She goes to a computer store and chooses a computer that costs €1,090, including the screen, keyboard and mouse. She also buys a scanner for €157, a CD burner worth €74, and a printer for €102. How much money will she have left over for her clothes?

Sandra's neighbor gives her a basket of nine eggs every time she watches her daughter. To make a Spanish caramel pudding, she needs three eggs. If Sandra was assigned to make 15 Spanish caramel puddings for her school's fundraiser, how many times does Sandra have to babysit?
Seth is twice Brooke's age, and in two years, their ages will add up to 28.
If Ethel has $8, how much money does Jimmy have right now?
Pancho walks 20 miles a day, except on weekends when he walks 10 miles.

The orchestra is ordering new uniforms. Each uniform is delivered with a hat that costs $25, a jacket that costs three times the hat, and pants that cost the average price of a hat and jacket. How much does each uniform cost in total?
Jake is walking through the Entomology Museum, and he sees 80 spiders with eight legs each, 90 insects with six legs each, and three rare mutant invertebrates with ten legs each.

There are four birds in the nest. Sally Two is three years older than Granny Red. Granny Red is twice as old as Sally Four. If Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirtytwo and Sally Thirtytwo is eight years older, what is the combined age of the four birds?

Jessica is trying to figure out how much she's paying off each month for all of her debts. Her student loan has a minimum payment of $300/month, her credit card has a minimum payment of $200/month, and her mortgage has a minimum payment of $500/month. If Jessica wants to pay 50% more than the minimum, how much will she pay off in a year?

Billy peels and cuts potatoes in preparation for preparing the potato salad for his big family barbecue. It's a big event, so he has to create 60 potatoes. The potatoes are about the same size, so it takes about the same amount of time to peel and cut each one. Billy takes about a minute and a half to peel a potato, but only about five seconds to cut it small. How long does it take Billy to complete potato preparation?

Juan and his brother Carlos are selling lemonade right now, and every gallon they make is $3 for lemons and $2 for sugar, and they sell each bottle for $0.50 and they get 20 bottles out of each gallon, and if you made $25 in profit, how much would you have spent on lemons?
In a race with 240 Asians, 80 were Japanese and the rest were Chinese, if the number of boys in the Chinese team was 60, how many girls were in the Chinese team?

Zaid spends a quarter of his salary on rent and a third on gasoline, and donates half of the remaining amount to his favorite charity. He gives his daughter $200 to use for her weekly expenses, and his wife $700 to plan food and other household items. If Zaid earns $6,000 a month, how much money will he have left after all this spending and donating?
Rani has 10 more cancers than Monic, who has 4 fewer cancers than Bo.
Lloyd makes $10 an hour for math tutoring, and he tutored five hours the first week, and eight hours the second week, so how much did he make in the first two weeks?

Two candidates are running to be class speakers at Sarai's school, and calculate the number of votes the loser got if the winner got three-quarters of the votes and the total number of students voting in the class was 80.

Sandra, the florist around the corner, is very unhappy with Fred's incomplete delivery of the order. Sandra had ordered four times as many red roses as white carnations. She also ordered 200 pink room calla, which was five times the number of white carnations. Sandra threatened to change the supplier if the missing red roses were not delivered by 5 p.m. How many red roses does Fred have to deliver by 5 p.m. to keep Sandra's shopping?
Jean is two years older than Mark. Two years ago, Mark was five years older than Jan's half-age. If Jan is 30, how old is Jean?

Two athletic teams compete in a 4 x 400 meter race; a race where each competing team has four members, each running 400 meters or a lap on a standard track. One of the two teams is very balanced, and each of its members will run their 400 meter laps in exactly 55 seconds. The other team is less balanced; its first runner we run his 400 meter laps in 60 seconds, then each following runner will run 3 seconds faster than the previous runner. Based on this information, how many seconds will the faster team gain?
Jerry rolls a six-sided die, what is the probability that he rolls a number greater than 3 than two even numbers in a row?
Jenna and her mother picked some apples on their apple farm. Jenna picked half as many apples as her mother. If her mother had 20 apples, how many apples did they both pick?

Russell works in a pet store and is distributing straw to the rodents. The rats are kept in three cages in equal groups and each rat is given six straws. There are 10 cages of hamsters that are kept alone, and each hamster is given five straws. There is also a rabbit barn where 20 straws are distributed among the rabbits. There is no straw distributed anywhere else in the store. If 160 straws were distributed among the small rodents, how many rats are in each cage?
Mandy owes Benedict $100, and they agreed to pay 2% interest on the loan, so if Mandy could pay Benedict after three months, how much did she have to give Benedict?

A merchant buys a few sacks of wheat from a farmer at a rate of $20 a sack. If it costs $2 to transport each sack from the farm to the warehouse, and the merchant made a total profit of $400 after selling all the sacks at a rate of $30 each, how many sacks did he sell?

Three friends spent $20.25 for three tickets to the fair. They also spent $4.50 less on food than they did on tickets. They also took two different trains that cost $33 each. If they agreed to split all the costs equally, how much did each of them pay?
John collects peaches for three hours. He can collect two peaches per minute. How many peaches does he collect?
Ducks need to eat 3.5 pounds of insects every week to survive, so if there's a flock of 10 ducks, how many pounds of insects do they need per day?
Tom plants 10 trees a year. Each year he also cuts down 2 trees a year. He starts with 50 trees. After 10 years, 30% of the trees die. How many trees does he keep?

Sue lives in a funny neighborhood. One weekend, her neighbors decide to play a prank on Sue. On Friday morning, the neighbors put 18 pink plastic flamingos out in Sue's front yard. On Saturday morning, the neighbors took away a third of the flamingos, painted them white, and put those freshly painted white flamingos back in Sue's front yard. On Sunday morning, they added another 18 pink plastic flamingos to the collection. How many more pink plastic flamingos were out on Sunday afternoon than white plastic flamingos?
Violetta wants to buy new crayons. She needs them in five different colors and she put aside $20 for this purchase. A crayon costs $2. How much change will she get?
A pencil costs as much as a pencil and eraser combined. A pencil costs $1.20 and an eraser $0.30. How much are eight pens?
200 pounds of carrots are to be distributed to 40 restaurants in a given city, each restaurant to receive two pounds of carrots.
The city of Soda has exactly 23,786 inhabitants. Of these, 8,417 are men and 9,092 are women. The rest of the population is made up of children. How many children are there in Soda?

Elaine started out with 20 Pokemon cards. After a month, she had collected three times that number. In the second month, she collected 20 fewer cards than she had collected in the first month. In the third month, she collected twice the number of Pokemon cards she had collected in the first and second months combined. How many Pokemon cards does she have now?

Mark is a proofreader. He proofreads the same number of sentences each week for two different editors, who each pay him a different rate per sentence. Editor B pays Mark twice what Editor A pays. Mark proofreads a total of 1,000 sentences each week, and Editor A pays him 5 cents per sentence. How much does Mark make in cents a week?

Baldur gets water from a well. He gets five buckets of water every morning and six buckets of water every afternoon. If each bucket contains five liters of water, how many liters of water does he get each day?

John wins a prize at work. The prize is a one-time monetary reward of $5,000 and a 5% raise. If he earns $2,000 per week every week of the year and he got the prize on the first day of the year, how much money did he make that year?
Josie plants grapes on her 10 acre farm. Each morning produces 5 tons of grapes a year and every ton of grapes makes 2 barrels of wine. How many barrels of wine does her farm produce a year?

Carl's favorite food is cheese. He ate a sandwich every day this week for lunch and used two slices of cheese on each sandwich. Three days a week he ate egg-cheese omelets for breakfast and used one more slice per omelet than he used per sandwich. He made a large portion of macaroni and cheese to make him enough for several dinners a week, and used eight slices of cheese for that. How many slices of cheese did he use?

Janet had 22 green pens and 10 yellow pens. Then she bought six bags of blue pens and two bags of red pens. There were nine pens in each bag of the blue ones and six pens in each bag of the red ones. How many pens does Janet have now?

Brinley is in Mr. Bert's math class. Mr. Bert takes six tests each semester. He allows students each semester to subtract the lowest score from the average. If Brinley has scores of 89, 71, 92, 100 and 86 on the first five tests, what score does she need on the sixth test to reach an average of 93?

Michael loves to ride his bike. He rode at least five times a week, doing 25 kilometers each time. He did this for four weeks, and then decided to ride his bike only twice a week, but 60 kilometers each time, and did this for three weeks. How many kilometers did Michael ride in total?

In Joe's Halloween candy bag are 25 bars of chocolate and 80 candied apples. Each bar of chocolate weighs twice as much as each candied apple. If each bar of chocolate weighs 40 grams, how much does Joe's candy bag weigh in grams?

Rose went to the store on Monday and bought four cakes. On Tuesday she went to another store and bought three times as many cakes. On Wednesday she went to another store and bought five times as many cakes as she had bought on Tuesday. How many cakes had she bought after all three days?
Twenty thousand cups cost $1200 less than the total cost of half a dozen plates, which are sold for $6,000 each. Calculate the total cost of buying each cup.

Sara wants to buy a new jacket and two pairs of shoes. The jacket she wants costs $30, and each pair of shoes costs $20. Sara watches the neighborhood kids four times and earns $5 for each time she watches them. Your parents pay her $4 for each time she mows the lawn. If Sara had already saved $10 before she started making hats, how many times does she have to mow the lawn before she can afford the jacket and shoes?

Jerry has a flock of chickens. The red hens lay 3 eggs a day and the white hens lay 5 eggs a day. Every day Jerry collects 42 eggs. If he has two more white chickens than red chickens, how many red chickens does he have?
Gary likes to walk around the edge of the local park, which is a rectangle measuring 1.5 miles by 6 miles. If he walks at 3 miles per hour, how many hours does he spend walking?

While in a one-euro shop, Sloane counts 100 customers entering the store, and the next day she counts 50 more customers than the first day. If the total number of customers on the third day was 500, how many customers did she count on the third day?

Jerry has two swimming pools, both with leaks of four gallons per minute. Four minutes ago, the big pool had twice the water of the small pool. Now the big pool has four times the water of the small pool. How much water does the small pool have now?
Lori wants to buy a pair of shoes for $320 and a matching belt for $32. She works part-time and is paid $8.00 an hour. How many hours does she have to work before she can make her purchase?
If Janeth borrows $2,000 and promises to pay it back with an additional 10 percent, if she pays $165 a month for 12 months, what will Janeth's balance be by then?
There are four roses in the vase. There are seven more dahlias than roses in the vase. How many flowers are there in the vase altogether?
Adrian's age is three times Harriet's age, and Harriet is half as old as Zack, so calculate the average age of the three in three years, when Harriet is now 21.

Four students scored a total of 251 points in a board game. Naomi scored 68 of the points. Yuri scored 10 points more than half as many as Naomi, and Brianna scored 17 points more than Naomi. How many points did Jojo score?

Carmen takes 10 minutes to finish a crossword puzzle, and 5 minutes to finish a Sudoku puzzle. Over the weekend, she solved 3 crossword puzzles and 8 Sudoku puzzles. How much time did she spend playing these games?

A water tank is filled with 120 liters of water. Celine used 90 liters of water from the tank to water her small garden. She was then able to collect twice as much rainwater as was left. How many liters of water are there now in the tank?
Andy plants 90 geraniums and 40 petunias less than geraniums. How many flowers does he plant in total?

A company spends $15,000 on advertising for one year and then spends a third of that amount on advertising for another year. What is the total amount the company spent on advertising in those two years?

Carlos and Benji are on the beach. Carlos rents a canoe for $30 an hour and Benji rents a banana water slide for $18 an hour. If Carlos uses the boat for three hours and Benji uses the water slide for five hours, how much do they pay in total for their rent?

Andrew is planning a trip from New Jersey to Rochester. It takes six days to travel by bus, and half as many days to travel by car from New Jersey to Rochester. How many days does he travel if he plans to travel by bus to Rochester and back from Rochester by car?

James is counting his Pokemon cards right now. He has 30 Fire, 20 Plants, and 40 Water. If he shuffles 8 of the Water and buys 14 Plants, what is the percentage probability (rounded to the nearest whole number) that a randomly drawn card will be a Water?

Chad ordered a make-your-own-burrito for lunch. The basic burrito costs $6.50. He adds extra meat for $2.00, extra cheese for $1.00, avocado for $1.00, and two sauces for $0.25 each. He decides to upgrade his meal for an extra $3.00, for which he adds chips and a drink. He has a $5.00 gift card that he uses at the checkout. How much more does he owe?

Kalinda is working on a 360-piece puzzle with her mother. Kalinda can usually add four pieces per minute. Her mother can usually place half as many pieces per minute as Kalinda. How many hours do they need to complete the puzzle?

One watermelon farm produces 120 baby watermelons. Ashlyn went to the farm after two months and found that 30 percent of the watermelons were ripe for harvest, so she took them home. When she came back two weeks later, three-quarters of the remaining watermelons were ripe, so she harvested them. How many watermelons were not ripe for harvest after the two weeks?
Mark buys a fleet of 12 cars for his company. Each car is available for $20,000. He pays 10% tax on the cars and another $1,000 for each of them for registration. How much does he pay for everything?

Kylie and Robert like to go to the beach to collect shells. On Monday, Kylie collects five more shells than Robert collects 20 shells. On Tuesday, Kylie collects twice as many shells as she collected on Monday. How many shells does Kylie collect on Tuesday?
Dax went to his farm to pick some apples, and found half as many beetles as ants in the garden.
There are 36 sun-drenched penguins in the snow. A third of them jump in and swim in the ocean. Another third go to the cave to eat dinner. How many sun-drenched penguins are left?

Steve decides to start eating more tomatoes and grow his own cherry tomatoes. He eats twice as much as his girlfriend. He eats six a day. If a stick can produce three tomatoes a week, how many sticks does he need?

John orders a couple of pizzas to share with his friends. There are 20 friends in total, and John wants to make sure that each of them can have four. Pizzas are only sold in eight portions. How many pizzas does John have to order?

Ram uses a bunch of pens. He discovers that he can save money by mixing the ink from five empty pens to make one full pen. If he buys 25 pens and then uses them to make new pens, when the ink runs out, how many pens can he have in total?
Johnny took his $20 in pocket money and added an extra $10 and then he invested that money, which tripled in one year.
Mary is two years younger than Joan, who is five years older than Jessa. If Jessa is 20 years old, what is the sum of the ages of the three girls?

The number of students in a classroom was 1000. The classroom had 3 entrances, A, B and C, which also served as exits. Calculate the number of students who left through exit C, if after a meeting 30% of the students left the building through exit A, 3/5 of the remaining students left through exit B and the rest went out through exit C.
James has six more candies than Robert. John has twice as many candies as Robert. If John has 54 candies, how many candies does John have more than James?
Dolly has two books. Pandora has one. If Dolly and Pandora both read each other's books and their own, how many books will they read in total?

Mike has corresponded with five people. He stopped corresponding with two of them. They each send him two letters a week, each one five pages long. He answers the same way. He can write one page every six minutes. How many hours does he spend writing a week?

Jason has a phone bill of 1,000 minutes a month. He has a 15-minute phone call with his boss every day and 300 extra minutes with other people this month. If this month has 30 days, how many minutes does Jason have left?

Griffin had 24 fries, but Kyle took five of them. Billy took twice as many as Kyle. Ginger gave Griffin a handful of her fries, and then Colby took three fewer fries from Griffin than Kyle had taken. If Griffin ended up with 27 fries, how many fries did Ginger give Griffin?

There are 4 snails in one aquarium and 32 snails in another aquarium. The difference between the number of snails in the two aquariums is equal to twice the number of fish in both aquariums. If both aquariums have the same number of fish in them, how many fish are there in each aquarium?

Jean's makeup artist charges her $250 an hour. She needs very expensive makeup for a movie she's in, and it takes six hours to do it every day, and she has to have it done four times a week. It takes five weeks to finish the movie. After the movie is done, the makeup artist gives Jean a 10% discount because of the amount of work done. How much did Jean pay?

Isabelle bought party supplies for her little sister's birthday party. She spent $12 on cake ingredients, $43 on birthday gifts, $15 on decorations, $4 on invitations, and $22 on bags of treats for the party guests. She divides the cost equally with both her parents by three. How many dollars did each person pay?
A cook bought four bags of onions, each bag weighs 50 pounds, and a pound of onions costs $1.50. How much did the cook spend?

On Monday, Sue ate four times as many cookies as her sister. On Tuesday, she ate twice as many cookies as her sister. Her sister ate five cookies on Monday, and the next day, 13. If one cookie has 200 calories, how many calories does Sue consume more than her sister?
